Description: Green glazed composition shabti of P3-3b-mḥ Sğswty bity rḫ nsw also called (Psmtk)snb Son of ʿ3-ḫt and T3-wpt-nfrt with a lappet-wig, a modelled face with ears and a beard and parallel hands in relief holding a relief adze, hoe and the string of the seed-basket that hangs over the shoulder; the leg section is inscribed with part of Chapter 6 of The Book of The Dead in nine rows of incised Hieroglyphs, the back-pillar is inscribed with incised Hieroglyphs, there is a plinth beneath the foot.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
